articles.headline: The Superglue Diet: How to Make a Lighter, Fuel-Sipping Car
articles.snippet: Carmakers are turning to airplane-quality glue for seams and thinner steel to trim weight, while looking ahead to using magnesium and coasting to save fuel.
articles.abstract: Carmakers are turning to airplane-quality glue for seams and thinner steel to trim weight, while looking ahead to using magnesium and coasting to save fuel.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The 2017 GMC Acadia sport utility vehicle that is just starting to arrive in dealerships around the country is 700 pounds lighter than the version it replaces, and can go 23 miles on a gallon of gasoline, up from 18 m.p.g., a 28 percent improvement.

articles.headline: How Much Does Donald Trump Pay in Taxes? It Could Be Zero
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump has not released his tax returns, but tax experts say it is possible and legal that he pays little or nothing in federal income tax.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump has not released his tax returns, but tax experts say it is possible and legal that he pays little or nothing in federal income tax.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney was excoriated during the 2012 presidential campaign for paying $4.9 million in federal income tax, or an average of just 14 percent of his adjusted gross income, in the two years for which he released returns.

articles.headline: Some Women Won’t ‘Ever Again’ Report a Rape in Baltimore
articles.snippet: The Justice Department found that Baltimore officers humiliated women who reported sexual assault, failed to gather basic evidence and disregarded prostitutes’ complaints.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department found that Baltimore officers humiliated women who reported sexual assault, failed to gather basic evidence and disregarded prostitutes’ complaints.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For the past two years, ever since 18-year-old Michael Brown was fatally shot by a Ferguson, Mo., police officer, America has been enmeshed in a wrenching discussion about how the police treat young black men.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Jess Bidgood

articles.headline: Fred Trump Taught His Son the Essentials of Showboating Self-Promotion
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump inherited more than just a real estate empire from his father. Fred C. Trump, a builder of homes in Brooklyn and Queens, was the Donald of his day.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump inherited more than just a real estate empire from his father. Fred C. Trump, a builder of homes in Brooklyn and Queens, was the Donald of his day.
articles.lead_paragraph: The throngs of New Yorkers who poured into Coney Island on a sweltering Sunday in July 1939 — shuffling past the rides, hot dog stands and freak shows — confronted one last spectacle blaring just beyond the surf.

articles.headline: How Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Differ on Taxes
articles.snippet: One major difference is that Mr. Trump would give the wealthy a big tax cut, and Mrs. Clinton would raise their taxes.
articles.abstract: One major difference is that Mr. Trump would give the wealthy a big tax cut, and Mrs. Clinton would raise their taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: If Donald J. Trump wins the White House and proceeds to persuade Congress to pass his tax agenda, middle-class Americans will get a small tax cut, wealthy Americans and businesses will get a huge tax cut, and the budget deficit will widen substantially unless there is the type of economic boom he promises amid lower taxes and lighter regulation.

articles.headline: The Big Pause You Should Take Before Co-Signing a Student Loan
articles.snippet: Lending your signature and good credit history to someone could indeed make a difference, but it comes with plenty of risk.
articles.abstract: Lending your signature and good credit history to someone could indeed make a difference, but it comes with plenty of risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: So someone has asked you to co-sign for a student loan.

articles.headline: Too Old for Hard Labor, but Still on the Job
articles.snippet: Some blue-collar workers trade the physical stress for related work that takes advantage of their knowledge and experience.
articles.abstract: Some blue-collar workers trade the physical stress for related work that takes advantage of their knowledge and experience.
articles.lead_paragraph: LIKE many people, Steve Guadalupe has had a varied career.

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Missteps Risk Putting a Ceiling Over His Support in Swing States
articles.snippet: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls.
articles.abstract: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOYLESTOWN, Pa. — Donald J. Trump has been waiting for months for a poll in which he cracks 50 percent of the vote against Hillary Clinton in any of his top battleground states: Florida, New Hampshire, Ohio or Pennsylvania.

articles.headline: Trillions in Murky Investments Could Rock China’s Economy
articles.snippet: Long on promises and short on details, investments known as wealth management products have drawn a flood of money — and pose a big risk.
articles.abstract: Long on promises and short on details, investments known as wealth management products have drawn a flood of money — and pose a big risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — The deal could be hard to resist.
